be.belgium.eid.eidcommon
Class TLV

java.lang.Object
  be.belgium.eid.eidcommon.TLV
Direct Known Subclasses:
FormattedTLV
public class TLV
extends java.lang.Object

The TLV performs operations according to the Tag-Length-Value protocol. This is the way how the data is stored on the eID smart card. Files are represented as sequences of TLV elements that consist of a tag name to uniquely identify the data that is represented. This tag is followed by the length of the data represented by the tag. Finally the data itself is stored as a sequence of bytes.
E.g.: imagine we want to store the first name and the last name of a person on a smart card or any other low-level device. Then we store the name 'Will Hunting' as a sequence of bytes (delimited by ;'s) as follows: '0;4;87;105;108;108;1;7;72;117;110;116;105;110;103'. Here the first byte is the tag for the first name, the next byte is the length of the first name and the next 4 bytes are the decimal representations of the ASCII characters of which the first name exists. After these bytes the same thing is done for the last name which has tag 1, length 7 and 7 decimal numbers representing the data.
For more information click here.

Version:
1.0.0 25 Nov 2007
Author:
Kristof Overdulve

Constructor Detail

TLV

public TLV()
Initializes the TLV with its default values. To input data in the TLV we have to perform parse(byte[]). Do this before trying to fetch data from the buffer.

TLV

public TLV(byte[] characterStream)
Initializes the TLV by parsing the given character string that represents the data.

Parameters:
characterStream - is the stream of characters to parse into a TLV map structure
Method Detail

parse

public void parse(byte[] byteacterStream)
Parses the input stream into a map structure to make the processing of the data easier. This method can be used multiple times with different byteacterStreams to combine multiple input byteacter streams. Watch out not to redefine keys that you don't want to redefine.

Parameters:
byteacterStream - is the stream of byteacters to parse into a TLV map structure

tagData

public byte[] tagData(byte tag)
Returns the data of the given tag. Returns null if there is no data associated with this tag.

Parameters:
tag - is the tag to identify the data to return
Returns:
the data associated with the given tag

getTLVElements

public java.util.AbstractMap<java.lang.Byte,byte[]> getTLVElements()
Returns the map structure of the TLV input stream. The key is the so called 'tag' uniquely defining the associated data.

Returns:
the map representing the input stream in a more structured way.
